sen.j: 岩倉尚具（いわくら なおとも、元文2年（1737年）‐寛政11年1月7日 (旧暦)（1799年2月11日）は、江戸時代中期の廷臣。
sen.e: Naotomo IWAKURA (1737 - February 11, 1799) was a retainer of Imperial Court who lived in the middle era of the Edo period.
Naotomo IWAKURA (1737 - February 11, 1799) was a retainer of the Imperial Court during the middle of the Edo period.
Naotomo IWAKURA (1737 - February 11, 1799) was a retainer of the Imperial Court during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: 官位は正五位下左兵衛佐（死後、従四位追贈）。
sen.e: He became Sahyoe no suke (an assistant captain of the left division of middle palace guards) at the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) (conferred Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) posthumously).
He became Sahyoe no suke (assistant captain of the left division of middle palace guards) at the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior 5th Rank, Lower Grade) (conferred Jushii (Junior 4th Rank) posthumously).

He became Sahyoe no suke (assistant captain of the left division of middle palace guards) at the rank of Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) (conferred Jushii (Junior Fourth Rank) posthumously).
His father was Takamasa UEMATSU.
His father was Takamasa UEMATSU.
His father was Takamasa UEMATSU.
His foster father was Tsunetomo IWAKURA.
His foster father was Tsunetomo IWAKURA.
His foster father was Tsunetomo IWAKURA.
Who was his mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.
His mother is unknown.
He called himself Gensui-in.
sen.cmt: 現水院： 読み方不明です。
sen.e: He called himself Gensui-in.
He called himself Gensui-in.

sen.j: 岩倉家の家督を継ぎ、叙爵もしていたが、すぐに弟乗具を養子として家督を譲って隠居した。
sen.e: He inherited the line of the Iwakura family and was ennobled as well, but he adopted his younger brother, Noritomo IWAKURA, as his son, and had Noritomo inherited the family line and started his retired and quiet life.

He inherited the line of the Iwakura family and was ennobled as well, but he adopted his younger brother, Noritomo IWAKURA, as his son, and had Noritomo inherited the family line and then started his retired and quiet life.

He inherited the line of the Iwakura family and was conferred to a peerage as well, but he adopted his younger brother, Noritomo IWAKURA, as his son, and had Noritomo inherited the family line and then started his retired and quiet life.
